attributes.comment:
I think the government needs to take note that adoption expenses are already very
high and most people are having to complete the same processes, such as
fingerprints twice for 1 adoption due to the length of adoption timeframe. $70 per
person is a lot of money for fingerprints that are only going to last 15 months.
When my husband and I went into the office to have them completed, there must
have been 6 or more associates sitting around in the chairs doing nothing. I think
that needs to be looked at before you raise the costs on to all of us. I feel we
already make a huge contribution as far as taxes, whether it be federal or state,
and my question to you would be, What is the need to rasie these fees, and why
can't finger printing last for a longer period than 15 months? Again, I think that
other options need to be addressed before you keep making all of us adoption
families pay an increase that may not be necessary.

The government knows that all of these steps are necessary in order to complete
an adoption, and I feel like I am being taken advantage of.

Thank you for hearing my concerns, and I hope you take all of this into
consideration before raising these prices. Please feel free to contact me if you
have any further questions regarding this matter.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Jessica Phiengthirath
